While Jerusalem was hushed in silence, and the disciples had returned to their homes to obtain refreshment in sleep, 
172
Jesus slept not. His divine pleadings were ascending to His Father for His disciples, that they might be kept from the evil influences which they would daily encounter in the world, and that His own soul might be strengthened and braced for the duties and trials of the coming day.\97(Review and Herald, August 17, 1886.)
